recipe.title: French Onion Soup
recipe.description: Rich, comforting soup with caramelized onions and melted cheese

steps.descr: Slowly caramelize onions in butter for 30-40 minutes
steps.instructions: Slowly caramelize onions in butter for 30-40 minutes

on_enter.say: Right, let's slowly caramelize these onions in butter. We're aiming for a lovely deep golden color, and this will take about thirty to forty minutes. Give it a good stir now and then.
Great job with the onions! Now, let's sprinkle over the flour and give it a good stir. This will help thicken our soup beautifully.

steps.descr: Add wine and let it bubble
steps.instructions: Add wine and let it bubble

on_enter.say: Now, pour in the white wine and let it bubble away. You'll hear it sizzle and smell that lovely aroma as the alcohol cooks off.

steps.descr: Pour in stock and thyme, simmer for 20 minutes
steps.instructions: Pour in stock and thyme, simmer for 20 minutes

on_enter.say: Let's pour in the beef stock and add some fresh thyme. Now, we'll let it simmer for about twenty minutes. This is where all those flavors come together beautifully.
While the soup is simmering, let's toast those slices of French bread until they're nice and golden. They'll add a lovely crunch to our soup.

steps.descr: Ladle soup into bowls, top with bread and cheese
steps.instructions: Ladle soup into bowls, top with bread and cheese

on_enter.say: Now, let's ladle that beautiful soup into bowls. Top each one with a slice of toasted bread and a generous handful of grated Gruyère cheese.

steps.descr: Grill until cheese is golden and bubbling
steps.instructions: Grill until cheese is golden and bubbling

on_enter.say: Time to pop those bowls under the grill. We're looking for the cheese to be golden and bubbling. This is the final touch to our delicious French onion soup!

notes.text:
Low and slow is key for caramelizing onions
Use good quality beef stock
Individual oven-safe bowls work best
